website_summaries.verdict: This low-profile drain protector is sized for bathtubs but also works well for utility sinks.
pros: Silicone ring helps the drain protector stay in place
Catches hair and still drains water
Can be placed in the dishwasher for cleaning
Makes it easy to hide and upgrade old tub drains
cons: This drain protector has a diameter less than three inches, which might be too small for some shower drains

customer_reviews.title: Sadly this even slowed the water from going down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it would be the perfect solution to catch hair, but I put it over the drain (fit PERFECTLY) and turned the shower on, and immediately the tub started to fill up - so the hair didn't go down the drain, but neither did the water - oops! Within a couple of minutes, I picked this one up and put my old one back on (it was getting warped & not working as well, but was still better than the oxo). My old one was this one:That one worked perfectly in my shower/tub.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie B

customer_reviews.title: Well made but didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I think this item is as good as this can get, very well made, and high quality. Even looks nice. I really thought it would work. It fit my drain well, I used this in a tile floor shower. It looked like it was sitting right against the drain but lots of hair was getting under it. Also it needed cleaning after every shower or two because the holes are pretty small, which they have to be for it to work. But if you skipped cleaning it for a couple showers the water stopped draining. Even clean it slowed the drainage a lot. I think my drains will just keep getting hairy, not sure what the answer is.
customer_reviews.author: Pollyessster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fix for frustrating stopper
customer_reviews.text: Just right to cover a sink drain and keep it easy to clean. The narrow rubber edge keeps it in place and makes it take up less visual space than the usual shower drain covers with tabs to hold them in. My American Standard bathroom sink has an irritating fancy mechanism to operate the stopper which frequently fails and also requires so much work to remove that grunge builds up. Removing the stopper and replacing it with this Oxo cover gives us more protection from losing things dropped in the sink and it’s far easier to clean the usual yuck quickly before it reaches nasty slime stage. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: This Bathtub drainer did not stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend visiting who sheds copious amounts of hair (I do as well) in the shower so I purchased OXO Good Grips Bathtub Drain Protector after reviewing several items. It didn't prevent water draining like others but did not stay in place and was constantly adjusting it to cover the drain. I hate return something so small. So currently on the lookout for a new one or some way for it to adhere to drain better. It's seems it could have been a simple fix just to make the outline heavier. So not happy with OXO.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews state that this doesn't stay put over the drain. I decided to try it anyways, but the other reviews were right. It does not stay put, it just sort of floats around, which obviously defeats the purpose of blocking the drain. I love OXO products, but take it from me and do not order this product.
customer_reviews.author: KT23

customer_reviews.title: Simple, very functional item!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Fits perfectly over our plastic green (blech) tub drain. I was worried it would move (read other reviews that had that problem) but ours stays put during our shower. The ONLY criticism is that it does slow down the water draining which is kind of annoying at the end of the shower (and I take long showers) but I just move it out of the way and make sure to grab the hair it catches with it. It does stop a lot of hair from going down and I shed A LOT, so it’s totally worth it! I just wipe it (and the hair) clean after each shower. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: hml.anon

customer_reviews.title: Ok....but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: So we have a bathtub and lots of hair been going down the drain. The tub has a stopper we use to fill up the tub so we can give kids a bath. To make this work for us we have to remove the pop-up stopper and cover the drain. When we wish to give the bath m....we must remove this and out the stopper back. To cumbersome for this purpose. I would say if you have a shower without a stopper, and just looking for a drain cover to prevent hair and large items to get in....this would work. The suction to the tub however is probably a 3 out of 5. Price however is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Catches long fine hair very well
customer_reviews.text: I have long thin hair and the rubber mushroom shaped thing that I was using before was not catching mush of my hair at all. Draino was become a weekly purchase! So I got this figuring it would had to be better than what I had and it works really well so far. My drain doesn't have any plug mechanism so the cover just sits over the hole and has never had a problem staying in place. I've been using it for about 3 weeks so far and haven't had a need to clean it, I just grab the hair buildup after each shower and throw it out and I haven't needed to clear the drain since I switched.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Works for mid-1980s tub
customer_reviews.text: We have a mid 1980s house in desperate need of bathroom updates. In the meantime, we deal with what we have. The tub has a non-removable drain cover with a slight upward curve (see pics). I was able to find very few covers that work. Nothing that sits down in the drain works, given the cover. This one was the only one I could find. It works surprisingly well. Hair sits on top so easy to wipe off. Seems to stay on drain well despite lack of any attachment mechanism— just weight and silicone edge. I’m very pleased with it and do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine stater

customer_reviews.title: Not Great Flow
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great product for most people. If you've got a shower that releases a lot of water like mine does, though, I would caution you before buying this. In my shower without this protector, water drains without any pooling of water. With this product, though, it pools sometimes up to an inch or so because there's not enough holes to allow water to drain. I think if you don't have awesome flow, it will be great, though - well made, good size and a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: nino chiarello

customer_reviews.title: loved at first, but now not so much
customer_reviews.text: we needed to cover our drain because the actual drain broke. This product does not allow water to drain properly. It causes the soap to remain at the bottom of the bowl and therefore creates build-up. It is extremely hard to keep clean. I have to clean with bleach at least every other day. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jegulzz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you need to develop a mold culture
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning it was an issue for me. It got that icky black stuff around the silicone too fast in my opinion. It only took a couple of months and it was in the trash. I replaced it at the dollar store. That one it's a year old. I had no problem with it staying put, nor blocking the water flow. I just don't like spending as much time cleaning the screen as I spend cleaning the whole tub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holes a little too small for a shower.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits well in my shower drain but the holes were too small to drain fast enough. I tested this before I actually took a shower and had I taken one, I would be standing in water. So I got a small drill bit and drilled holes in every other hole, just enough to leave a barrier in between holes and the shower now drains just as quick as it did without the drain. And the holes are still small enough to keep out sewer pipe bugs, which is why I bought it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Duzan

customer_reviews.title: Measure before you buy and it'll be perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, easy to clean, easy to remove. Measure before you buy. My drain (including the flat metal rim) is just under 3 inches and this fit perfectly on the metal rim. It does not have suction, but when measured correctly, will sit on top of the metal - it looks like it was built into my tub.
customer_reviews.author: TeacupsNTextbooks

customer_reviews.title: #1 for price and function
customer_reviews.text: After trying five hair drain catchers this was my pick to keep! It does move a little bit sometimes when you turn the bathtub water on at first and turn it off. However I have figured out if you have a little water underneath it you can press down and suction it pretty well to around the drain. I think it looks being and catches the hair really well as also lets water flow through. #1 in my book for price, look and function.
customer_reviews.author: JulieS

customer_reviews.title: SO SO
customer_reviews.text: Great for my bathtub to keep the hair from going down the drain and clogging the pipes. Quality seems good however it moves too much for my liking! They’re pretty basic overall just better quality than your $1 store. I wished it would stay still, the silicone perimeter doesn’t help too much but does help to keep still slightly especially when the shower head is running and not the water from the tub (high pressure moves the drain protector).
customer_reviews.author: adelu

customer_reviews.title: Best drain cover yet
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every drain cover out there. The little mesh baskets were a pain the clean out. This drain cover is curved, so the hair swirls above it and then lands nicely on top so easily removed. This item does not float (hair floats), but it is susceptible to shifting. For me, my bathtub drain is indented so this cover sits inside that nicely. Even if it shifts a little bit, the drain is still covered. You can also turn it over so the curve faces down to get it to not shift, but then some of the holes may be covered. Either way - if your tub is like mine, you should get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my bath tub plug so protect the drain from getting super clogged with hair when bathing my dogs. It works just as intended and is super easy to clean hair off of. My only tiny problem with it is that it moves about 1/2 an inch rather easily when I turn the water on. So I just have to scooch it back to completely block hair. Overall though, a good product for the cost and sits my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Zack F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s good, not great. It definitely stops hair from going down the drain, which is exactly why I bought it, so no complaints there. It’s easy to clean, and it’s not an eye sore. My only grump with it is that it won’t stay in place! I find that it wants to move with the slightest bit of water pressure. Once I get the shower going, it seems to be okay, but until then... it’s all over the place. Small gripe, overall a pretty good option. I think I would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Stocker

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem to catch any hair, and dammed up the shower. We were looking to replace our TubShroom because the bottom turned black (as it has for others, and the black appears permanent), but this device is worthless. Don't waste your time. Doesn't catch hair, so it is easy to clean. Easy to remove, just "sits" on the drain, lifts right up.
customer_reviews.author: RagsToRags

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this just doesn't work in my shower. It's size is off, and the rubber grips on the backside don't stop it from sliding. So what happens is that just the force of the water is enough to knock it off center, which allows hair/debris to get by it. The net result is that my drain clogs nearly as fast as without using it at all. The cheap $2 wire mesh one I bought at Meijer works better. Disappointing because it is nicely made - high quality.
customer_reviews.author: kbs

customer_reviews.title: Stays put and does the job
customer_reviews.text: It stays put and it collects hair really well. Very easy to clean the hair off and it's actually kind of gross how much gunk it collects. My only issue is that a little bit of pink mold keeps developing underneath the lip of it no matter what I do. Overall it's a great fix for the price to cover your shower drain and a heck of a lot cheaper than dealing with a clog!
customer_reviews.author: austenfitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this bathtub drain, it is just so simple to use. It is easy to collect hair compared to the original mesh drainer I used before. It fits well; however, it is so easy to move around. If I carelessly touch it when I was showering, it will move without me knowing about it so a lot of hair was drained down which is not so good. I wish this drainer has a little more friction so it would stay better.
customer_reviews.author: MaiMai

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a plastic hair catcher that made the soapy water back up in my tub. This is so much better. Barely any back up. By the time I'm finished showering the tub has completely drained. Saves me time and water because I don't have to keep trying to rinse the soap down the drain. An extra benefit was that it fits my new rectangle shaped bathroom sink with a pop up drain. I'm going to order more and recommend this product to my family and friends. Hair is easily removed with a swipe of a tissue.
customer_reviews.author: MKP

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to keep my long hair from going down the shower drain-- it's perfect! The rubber edges allow it to cling to the rim of the drain enough to stop hair (and sand... I'm a scuba diver... there's ALWAYS sand..) and also allows for easy removal / cleaning. Extremely happy with the purchase, especially at this pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: cltucker916

customer_reviews.title: It really catches hair
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really have suction--but it's a good weight and the rubber seal does keep it in place in our bathtub drain. The big plus is that it does catch hair! Even fine, thin hair gets captured. A potential downside is that if you shed much, the hair does slow down how quickly water drains away. It's super-easy to clean and it looks nice. Overall, for the price, it's a good item.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Henry

customer_reviews.title: Size is not 3"
customer_reviews.text: The size doesn't cover the 3" my rusty bathtub drain. Now I have to get another one. The problem is to find a size exactly for the 3" drain! I bough another cover and I lost the money too! Three plumber didn't want to change it because the building is over 40 years old with old metal pipes so they don't want to get liable for wherever happens in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Coha92

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but I like it after several months
customer_reviews.text: I have hair on the shorter side (1-2") and was initially worried the larger holes on this unit, perhaps a quarter inch in diameter, would let my hair through. However, it does a remarkably good job when I go clean the trap. It does indeed grab short hairs. My other worry was that it doesn't suction down or lock into place. It just stays via friction. This has proved surprisingly adequate to keep it in place. Overall, looks good, easy to clean, simple to install, I'm happy. For an improvement I'd like it it was slightly larger in diameter and could be locked into place with something a bit more reliable than friction.
customer_reviews.author: Dad guy

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: i had the tub shroom and it was really gross how moldy and slimy it got so i decided to give this one a try since oxo usually has pretty good products. it fits on top of the bathtub drain perfectly, almost looks like it came with it! it lets through enough water so tub doesn't start filling up, but catches enough of the hair. definitely would recommend this over the tub shroom.
customer_reviews.author: vcw

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?
customer_reviews.text: For something so simple this is working really well on my slightly recessed bathtub shower drain. So easy to swipe the build up hair while taking a shower and after. And even with the shower water pounding on it it didn't move an inch which was my biggest concern. I'm going to see if the larger one will work in my parents' shower.
customer_reviews.author: The Simple Life

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old bathtub (1930s) and cannot open the drain grate. Ive tried a bunch of these things but this works the best so far. Hair and "gunk" really seems to collect on it and that means less going down my old drain pipes. It does move a bit but if you are careful - not swooshing the water up against it and resetting it if it does move - it works just fine. Drains are moving better. Very pleased !
customer_reviews.author: Romeyd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with one caveat!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drain protector except i feel like it's a tad to small.. It will slip out of place if the bathtub spout is on.. uggh.. I wish it was a bit bigger, doesn't stay in place but very good about keeping hair out of the drain, I used to have one of those plastic things and so much hair i was still digging out of the drain all the time and it would get moldy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This little domed and perforated disk does everything I expected. It measures 2 3/4" across and fits nicely over my tub drain. The rim of it is a tapered grey rubber material and seats nicely over my tub drain. It does clog every couple days and needs to be cleaned off though. I guess that means it's doing its job since it's supposed to keep hair and gunk from going down the drain and, potentially, clogging my pipes. All-in-all, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward D. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Finally JUST a replacement drain cover for my bathtub. I tried periodically to find the kind from the hardware store that just snap into the drain hole, but never found the proper size. The kind with the wide and flat edges were :too: wide and lifted from being too close to the tub's side under the faucet, and/or had too-small holes to actually drain just water and soap suds when showering. This OXO cover "rests" (the plastic edges are grippy) on top of the whole drain. Zero issues with sliding around after a week, yet is easily removed when desired. Who knew something so simple would be so hard to find?
customer_reviews.author: essa

customer_reviews.title: I'll just say that I used to use the round plastic type that goes partially down into the drain which worked pretty well, but I was always replacing them because ...
customer_reviews.text: How much can one say about a bathtub drain protector? Well, I'll just say that I used to use the round plastic type that goes partially down into the drain which worked pretty well, but I was always replacing them because they'd get so discolored that I'd use a little vinegar or bleach to clean them and then they'd begin to break down. This one eliminates all of that. It's perfect. Catches all the hair and easy to clean -- just wipe the hair away with a tissue or your fingers. Just the right size. Stays put. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover in Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Ditched the 'shroom!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after realizing the tub shroom wasn't keeping all the hair out of the tub drain. This one catches it and although the hair needs to be wiped off after about 2-3 showers, it doesn't get gross and disgusting like the 'shroom. It does move slightly when you first turn on the water but a little nudge with your big toe is enough to take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzco

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great purchase. The cover is exactly the same size as our drain and looks very nice when the placement is correct. The cover shifts a bit when the water is turned on at the spout but doesn’t shift if the shower head is turned on first or quickly. It also stays in place all other times. Seems to be catching all hair, where the original drain cover let hair go through and required the pipe to be snaked ever so often. Over all worth it👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Nei Antunes dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have for Drains that Clog Easily
customer_reviews.text: My bathtub drain has huge holes and though I don't shed much hair, I do have the occasional few strands in the tub. Over time, that accumulates and the tub drains slower. At some point, I'll have to snake the drain, which often pulls out an animal stuck in your drain. It's gross. I've had this protector for over a year now and my tub is still draining at full speeds. The protector itself hasn't rusted but I noticed the drain cover is starting to rust on the edges. Overall, the protector does a great job of preventing hairs from slipping through and has never shifted on me.
customer_reviews.author: Icy Y.

customer_reviews.title: Review almost 4 years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drain blocker in July 2016. It's March 2020 and it has moved to multiple apartments with me and has blocked the hair of male and female roommates. I have never cleaned it, yet somehow it looks perfectly clean, almost new. It moves around a little, but mostly stays in place and is easy to manage. It's one of my oldest, most used items.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Not stable, moves around and lets hair down
customer_reviews.text: It keeps most, if not all the hair from going down the drain, but it has barely any grip on the drain hole at all if any. So whenever the water pressure right on top becomes a bit too strong, this protective cover slips away slightly and lets a bit of hair down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Christophe Ahn

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the Tub Shroom! The Tub Shroom got so gross, moldy, and was hard to clean. This was a perfect fit over my tub drain and clean with a simple swipe. I love that it’s stainless when makes it more durable than the tub shroom’s plastic. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Traps my hair. What more can you want?
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved into an ancient house with a claw foot tub in it (it's like a hundred years old). Unfortunately, the house is a rental and we have to deal with the badly draining tub. I hesitated buying this because others had said it would float up and not stay in place. I have had no troubles at all. It covers the drain, collects the pounds of hair I lose every shower, and only moves when I hit it, chalk that up to user error. I would definitely recommend. It has saved me from having to buy drain unclogger every month.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but useless
customer_reviews.text: This is the best looking of all the shower hair catchers I tried and is better than having no protector, but does little to actually stop your drain from getting clogged. I had to get my drain snaked every couple of months with this and then switched back to the less pretty Danco drain cover and haven't had an issue since
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Simple yet useful product. We all face the same dilemma, clogged drain due to hair. This product alleviates this issue by trapping the hair and ease of cleaning after a shower. Yes, there are other products out there but they don't allow much water to seep thru which causes more dirt in the tub. This product remains in place with my tub. My shower and lower spout produce water pressure and it never moves from its place. I want to clarify my tub has a drop towards the hole, it does not seat flat and evenly on the tub surface. That sure helps.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Contributor

customer_reviews.title: WAY BETTER THAN THE TUBSHROOM
customer_reviews.text: I have used the tubshoroom and a similar to one to that but this is by far the best! With the other ones they would always get clogged with conditioner and they were wayyyy to difficult to clean. I love that this is made very well and flat. It stays on the tub drain even when there is a lot of water. When they gets too much hair I just scrub it for half a second to pick up the hair off. I like that the holes are bigger so it drains the water faster. I am actually going to purchase these for my bathroom sinks cuz the ones I have are so hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Best I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Have tried the mushroom hair catcher, plastic catchers, and the mesh ones from Home Depot. They get so gross and hard to clean. This has been one of the better catchers. Would be even better if it was a bit bigger or heavier to stay put over the drain.
customer_reviews.author: JENNA

customer_reviews.title: Another great OXO product!
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great and works well. I needed to replace a white plastic recessed screen that was ugly and got gross to clean. This OXO screen stops the hair from going down the drain. Yes, because it isn't raised real high, it can block water if a lot of hair lays on top. Problem is easily solved in 5 seconds by removing the hair if I see water not draining. It is easy to clean too. I've not had it float like some other reviewers stated, and I've been using it for months. I also like the silicone edge. OXO products never let me down!
customer_reviews.author: MinnesnowtaMichele

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the items that go into the drain itself. Hair simply is on top and you pull it off. Not seeing much getting through the holes into the drain. It also isn’t developing mold or leaving a weird film on my drain like the tub shroom did.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Cunnington

customer_reviews.title: Best Drain Protector Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best drain protector I have ever used. It stays in place and catches the hair. I am buying another one for another tub in my house! The reviewer who said it starts to fill up the bathtub must not be cleaning it. Cleaning the top off every other shower seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the hair out of the drain
customer_reviews.text: My roommate and I shed a lot of hair in the shower; previously, we had a Tubshroom, which did a great job of keeping hair out of the shower, but had to be cleaned every few days and quickly become yellow/pink/blue with mold. (Maybe the secret is to not leave it in the drain...unsure.) In any case, we replaced it with this drain protector, which does an equally great job of keeping hair from going down the drain and is much easier/less gross to clean. It doesn't suction into place over our drain, but doesn't move when the water hits it either. Love it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Great for the small holes and size
customer_reviews.text: Great drain cover. Fits over my old drain cover (which has bigger holes) perfectly and catches every hair. I have fairly short hair too about 2 inches long. Took me a while to decide between this one and an identical one that was bigger. Then I realized my drain is very close the end of the tub so the bigger one wouldn't have fit properly. Glad I noticed this.
customer_reviews.author: Al Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Small And Sleek
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfectly over my shower drain but i noticed that the holes seem a tiny bit too small and reduce the flow of water some. Not enough to complain about but it is noticeable. Even then this was a great purchase to replace the last cover i had which began to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Simon

customer_reviews.title: May cause serious injury
customer_reviews.text: It collects everything, even the tiniest hairs. But it gets clogged so easily. I have to clean it 3 times while showering because even 1 strand of hair is too much for this to handle. It's either that, or shower in a pool of water and risk the dreaded trench foot..so I just dont use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good provided you remove the current cover
customer_reviews.text: I thought you could leave it on the current bathtub drain cover. Turns out that it was very slightly small than my current drain cover and so wouldn't completely overlap the current cover thus defeating the purpose. That also made this cover float. But then I took the old drain cover off and placed only this new one and then it seems to stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in our camper tub/shower!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I purchased this for our tub/shower drain for our travel trailer camper. It works great and fits perfect in the drain indentation. The rubber seal around the drain protector prevents it from moving around but is still easy to remove to clean off. In addition, the holes are big enough to allow water to pass through to prevent standing water in the tub/shower. Perfect for preventing clogged pipes, as well as nothing passing thru to our grey tank. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs LB

customer_reviews.title: I like it, it works just need suction
customer_reviews.text: I like this drainer however it doesn't stay in place it lays on top of the drain and when I turn on the shower it gets pushed to the side it doesn't hold to the drain but otherwise it keeps things from going down the drain so I guess it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Blocks water from draining
customer_reviews.text: It catches the hair, but also completely blocks the water from draining. First time using it, water built up around my ankles almost as badly as if I'd completely stopped the drain. It wasn't my hair, since I have short hair and had just started using it, and it wasn't hair product, it was just the drain cover itself. Once I removed it, the water drained like normal. Total waste of money. I guess I'll try the TubShroom next.
customer_reviews.author: Aly L.

customer_reviews.title: No More Hair in the Drain
customer_reviews.text: This works great! We were having issues with hair clogging our old corroded pipes that need to be replaced. We are not ready for that project just yet and this thing is saving our a**es. Easy to pull the hair off the top with a bit of toilet paper every few days.
customer_reviews.author: vando

customer_reviews.title: takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: As others mentioned there is no suction on this, so when you turn on the faucet (or turn off the shower and the water comes out of the faucet), it pushes forward and the hair goes down the drain. However, I do like this is super easy to keep clean and doesn't seem to get mold like the white plastic ones do. And after a few days it was easy to get into the habit of removing the hair before turning the shower off.
customer_reviews.author: maf

customer_reviews.title: Keeps debris out of pipes!
customer_reviews.text: It keeps out all debris from going into the pipe system; however, it is so strong at keeping stuff out of the drain that daily one has to clean the lid from debris to keep the water flowing through the tiny holes. I don't mind. Better that than a costly pipe treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: This drain is perfect! I also own the OXO Good Grips Silicone ...
customer_reviews.text: This drain is perfect! I also own the OXO Good Grips Silicone Drain Protector for Pop-Up & Regular Drains and find that hair slips under the drain protector. This drain protector creates a great seal and the hair all stays on top and swirls in the water on top and is super easy to remove. I HATE touching hair that is not attached to my head and I especially hate untangling hair from drain protector. This drain protector does not require untangling and the hair just slides off into the trash can. I'm so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nori

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who has long hair. Washing her hair would clog the drain in her shower at least twice a month it seemed. This has prevented this problem. It is very easy to remove and clean and stays put nicely.
customer_reviews.author: LKing

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient for people with long hair
customer_reviews.text: Previously had the tubshroom, and although it was effective it was extremely inconvenient for the shower/tub since it required removal of the shroom by hand to remove hairs. With this I can just push the hairs to the side and continue happily with my shower.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze !

customer_reviews.title: Good size but doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect size, and it does catch a lot of hair. However, I wish it were heavier. Each time I turn the tub faucet on (before diverting the water to the shower), the force of the water pushes it out of place, so I have to bend over and put it back each time. They need to make a design that either has an option to screw it into place, make it heavier, or have some way of securing it better.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: It works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: This product works so well for me I am writing a second review. Who knew how much hair and goo went down our drains...no wonder they get clogged. This little product stays put in both my tubs and catches all the hair and soap and things that would have been in the drain. I wish I had has this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: fishers, in

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: So far do good. It does not slow down water drainage, and seems to stay in place. I’m not sure how it stays in place because it’s small and light. It might be because of the silicone edged bottom. I’d buy again if I had another shower drain.
customer_reviews.author: MSM1023

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t suction to the drain but has weight to it so doesn’t move around when in use. Easy to remove and clean. Perfect solution to my apartment’s bad plumbing and huge drain. I no longer have to Drain-O weekly- a huge plus when you have animals and children around!
customer_reviews.author: JBMSML

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works well as expected. I'm using this in a shower which has a 3" OD "step" about 1" deep feeding the standard 2" drain. This screen has a 2-3/4" OD and sits over the drain within the aforementioned 3" step nicely. Screen arrived not perfectly flat, presumably from shipping in a bubble mailer, but is easy enough to tweak flat. Note that drain flow is obviously slightly restricted vs. an open drain.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but moves around
customer_reviews.text: Definitely does the job, but when I run the water to start the shower, the drain cover will move. I have to make sure I clear out hair before I run the water so it won’t go down the drain when the cover moves. There’s really no suction action to keep the cover in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clogs the sink
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, even with the holes this still prevents water from going down the drain. All I have to do is lift and let out the air and them it works again but that is pretty annoying. It does a good job of catching food and it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Looks great moves a little
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since I had my tub repainted and wanted to cover up the ugly drain. Now I'm really happy since it does capture the hair very well. It stays in place for me while taking a shower. The only time it moves is when the tub faucet blasts on it. Then only a little and easily slides back into place.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble2

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do, traps hair while letting water drain. And the water drains so much better than with the $1 plastic hair catchers I would buy from Walmart, which would get clogged and replaced constantly. My drain is set in a shallow crater in my tub, so I haven't had a problem with it getting swept away. It may stray a bit from dead center, but stays in the slight divot...if your drain isn't set slightly lower like that I can see how it might float away, but if it is you probably need some Dran-o. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: MoYahgler

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Now that the boys are grown, our tub/shower unit is in full shower mode. It has not seen a bath in over a decade. Recently, the fixture which hold the stopper elevated broke, leaving us to deal with a sealed stopper or a completely open void in the tub. This drain protector is just the right solution. It sits nicely on the ring surrounding the drain and the silicon keeps it firmly in place. Exactly what we need. No worries about losing anything down the drain and no issues with a loose fitting plug. Oxo comes through again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Texas

customer_reviews.title: kept moving
customer_reviews.text: Got this for use in my tub but it kept moving around and didn't stay put very well if the water current was too strong. I use this mainly for when I give the dogs a bath and it catches all the hair very well but once you remove all the fur, the rush of water kinda blows it out of place too easily.
customer_reviews.author: LocomOean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Find
customer_reviews.text: This really worked! We were looking for something to catch hair but could also be removed when we wanted to put our stopper in. Nothing else worked before this. I like it looks sleek and very easy to clean with a paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect in our tub.
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfectly on our tub. It doesn't stick on it though and it moves easily, so you have to be careful when removing the hair that got caught on it. Otherwise, it will just fall in the hole and defeats the whole purpose of this.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Mathis

customer_reviews.title: A great product and solution
customer_reviews.text: We had an old tub drain on an old tub that could not be removed without causing major damage. This provided both a new strainer and new look to go with all new fixtures. An inexpensive resolve and upgraded hair catcher.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G.

customer_reviews.title: Catches all the hair
customer_reviews.text: I added this to our bathtub drain to catch the hair before it goes down the drain. I like how the piece fits the drain so it looks like it belongs, doesn't move around and it's easy to clean the hair off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Ray

customer_reviews.title: OXO Good Grips Bathtub Drain Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I just put this in the tub, which has a small indentation around the actual drain, and it fits well and catches hairs and any other thing (like maybe a little spider) I just lift it out of the drain (I prefer when it is dry) and basically just wipe it off over the trash.
customer_reviews.author: CatMac

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with this drain protector. Size-wise, it fits perfectly over my drain. The holes are small enough that my hair does not manage to get through. I previously had a soft plastic drain protector that did the job just fine, but looked a mess after a few months. The stainless steel look and coloring of this seem to be holding up much better. I do have to make sure that it is covering my drain after I have the spigot on before pulling the shower on. The pressure of the water from the spigot sometimes move the cover out of position, but this is a really minor and infrequent occurrence. Overall, I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: EMG

customer_reviews.title: Best drain protector yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite drain protector so far, it catches my hair great and cleans easy. Other products I have tried clog within one use, this lasts maybe a week before it’s necessary to remove the hair. The thing cleans amazing and doesn’t attract soap scum like other products.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with function
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this protector. I was a bit hesitant based on other reviews and issues with floating. However, I have had zero issues with that. The protector stays in place and has never floated or moved. I'm interested into why others have experienced this. Maybe they have knockoffs or an older revision. The only complaint has come from my girlfriend. In that the water does drain quick enough for her liking. But, that'll happen with any drain cover. It's a inconvenience necessary to avoid a great clog.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan H.

customer_reviews.title: Wish these were a little big but good for what they do
customer_reviews.text: These don't completely keep hair from goin down the drain, but works better than some other things. I particularly like the low profile and its very easy to clean and stays in place relatively well.
customer_reviews.author: Bookmaven

customer_reviews.title: Slides around a bit
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use and looks nice. Unfortunately, it slides away when you start the tub focet. It stays in place when showering when water isn’t hitting it. But I have to adjust it each time I start the water before turning on the shower. I guess it depends on your turn-on-shower routine.
customer_reviews.author: rgn

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with this product they showed a video which includes I think like 3/4 items but after u pay and when u received the package and open it’s only one little lid. Not nice to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've bought
customer_reviews.text: I have thick, curly hair and I've gone through so many drain protectors! This is hands down the best at keeping hair out of the drain and is easy for me to clean. It is worlds better than a shroom that drops in the drain. My only caveat is that it sits on top of the drain without much suction, so I do sometimes kick it out of place in the shower. Still the best at collecting hair.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bell

customer_reviews.title: As expected with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: This is great for those shower drains that don't fit your typical mesh drainer trap. It's aesthetically attractive and easy enough to clean. HOWEVER, I definitely notice that it doesn't catch as many hairs as the mesh trap I used in my last tub. Smaller hairs just flow right through. I've only used it for a few weeks so I'm not sure how well this will hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Good at stopping hair - Need to keep it clean
customer_reviews.text: This seems pretty effective at catching stray hairs before they slip down the drain, however the holes are very small and get clogged quickly with soap scum, etc. Need to clean it frequently or it will stop the water from draining.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Hair Catcher
customer_reviews.text: This works ok I suppose. I didn't want a rubber or plastic one because of how hard they are to clean. Being old, I tend to lose a lot of hair so I really needed one! Like others have commented though, if you use soap, shampoo & conditioner all at the same time .. it tends to be a mess cleaning this off and it is just shy of completely covering my existing Bronze drain cover (which you can see slightly underneath) so a tiny bit of hair tends to still catch onto that. But, I'm still using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A drain strainer...
customer_reviews.text: that works, and is easy to remove and clean - unlike those little "basket" type that fit in the drain. This stays put, does its job, and then is easy to lift away from the tub and clean off.
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Suction?
customer_reviews.text: The water pressure kept moving it all around the place. Loved the look but did not do the trick. I'm sure that my drain being flat did not help the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Fries

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like this at all does not stay on my bathtub , hair goes around it and goes down drain so now I’m still cleaning out drain plus cleaning this thingamagig too. Very flimsy. Can’t seem to find any here on amazon that works. Tried a few already
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great good looking hair stopper!
customer_reviews.text: This works great at stopping hair from going down the drain. The plastic around the out and lower part of the drain cover is heavy and so it does not move unless you grab it or give it a good kick. The holes are small and spaced out enough so that hair is caught, really easy to clean. And it looks nice, a good cover for ugly drains. I have been using it for a while and I am very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Cornbizzle

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while, gets rusty easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a great strainer for the shower. Catches most of the hair before it gets swept down the drain. Gets rusty after a while though. And the gooey gunk collects underneath. Still impressed, though! So I bought another one!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: No more disgusting hair ball in my drain. I have pretty long hair and was so grossed out every time I had to use my hair catcher hook thingy to clean the hair out of my drain. I'm very happy I got this, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in a bathtub!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally had gotten a shower drain from Oxo an that will not work lol. I didn't know they had these available and this is perfect for bath tubs. The shower drain protector is much wider but the hair will slip under. I shed hair like crazy so I needed something reliable to cover my bathtub drain. This fits perfect and does not budge. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie M

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Need to strain drain-clogging hair from teenagers in shower. Works great if cleaned after each use. If it keeps me from pouring boiling water down the drain and plunging I am happy. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.  Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, Perfect size, Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The size of this hair catcher fits perfectly for my bathtub drain. I like it that hair can be removed easily from it. It stays in place when showerhead is running. However, it could move when water runs too fast from the spout as my spout sits directly on top the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Eunice

customer_reviews.title: which is quite surprising as I've used plastic products (with a wider suction edging) that move rather easily once the water deepens (from falling hair while shampooing)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the cat's meow for catching hair in the tub drain! It truly does not move once you place it over the opening .. which is quite surprising as I've used plastic products (with a wider suction edging) that move rather easily once the water deepens (from falling hair while shampooing). So it's my favorite drain cover.
customer_reviews.author: Shang

customer_reviews.title: Great drain protector for bathtub
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time finding a drain protector for my new place which had an older tub (from the 80s). None of the tub strainers seem to fit. This works great and its easy to clean. Some people complained about it not draining water quick enough. I don't seem to have that problem but I also clean it each time after I shower. If you don't, it will clog. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Bathtub Drain Protector
product_meta.description: Keep your bathtub drain clean and clear with the OXO Good Grips Bathtub Drain Protector. This rust-proof stainless steel Drain Protector neatly covers bathtub drains and won't get in the way. The hole pattern effectively catches hair without blocking water drainage. A silicone rim keeps the Drain Protector in place and prevents it from sliding around.
feature_bullets: Scaled to fit over bathtub drains
Effectively catches hair while allowing water to drain
Silicone rim helps keep Drain Protector in place
Also great for utility sink drains

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,914 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
